intro: Treubella triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered treubella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is often found in dense undergrowth of forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
